page.title: Pricing
page.goal: Convert qualified buyers into starting an intake with a clear tier choice and clear understanding of credits and add-ons.

sections.headline: Pick a tier. Get a better website, fast.
sections.subheadline: Answer a few questions. We generate a plan and a preview. You approve before anything ships.
bullets: Revision credits included (buy more any time)
sections.notes: Keep hero short. 1 primary CTA. Make tier clarity visible without scrolling on desktop. On mobile, hero must fit within ~1.25 screens.

sections.headline: Three tiers, three outcomes
sections.subheadline: Choose based on how much change you want and how many revision loops you need.
bullets: Standard: polish pass (messaging + spacing + CTA hierarchy)
Growth: conversion pass (proof + outcomes + trust elements)
Premium: full transformation (positioning + design system + strongest hierarchy)
sections.notes: Use 3 cards with consistent layout. Each card must include: price placeholder, credits included, who it's for, deliverable type (showroom vs builder), and a single CTA.

sections.headline: Compare tiers
sections.subheadline: A simple grid that explains what changes as you move up.
sections.notes: Rows should include: credits included, initial loops, deliverable (showroom / builder-executed UI), pressure-test loop, support level, typical use case. Use checkmarks, avoid dense text.

sections.headline: How revision credits work
sections.subheadline: Requesting changes consumes 1 credit. Approving is free.
bullets: 1 request changes = 1 credit = 1 additional improvement loop
When credits run out, you can buy more
sections.notes: This section must be crystal clear. Add a small example: 'Premium includes 10 credits → up to 10 request-changes loops.' No pricing numbers unless provided elsewhere.

sections.headline: Add-ons (optional)
sections.subheadline: Connect the tools you already use. We'll help configure workflows where supported.
bullets: Phone Engine (call forwarding + missed call capture)
sections.notes: Do NOT promise specific integrations unless they exist in product. Each add-on should have a 'Learn more' expand/collapse with requirements and what the customer must connect.

sections.headline: FAQ
sections.notes: Include FAQ items: what is included, what is a credit, what happens after intake, can I buy more credits, do you deploy automatically, what pages are included, what is Premium builder scope. Keep answers short and truth-pack safe.

sections.headline: Ready to see your improved site?
sections.subheadline: Start with the intake. Get a plan and preview. Approve when it's right.
sections.notes: Sticky CTA on mobile should appear by ~20% scroll, not later.

mobileRequirements: All tier cards must stack cleanly (no 3-across on mobile)
No horizontal scroll at any breakpoint

mustPass: One clear primary CTA in hero
Tier cards readable on mobile and stack vertically
Credits explanation is explicit and unambiguous
No new claims about integrations or guarantees
shouldPass: Comparison table is scannable in <10 seconds
